task.title: Fuel System Operation
task.shortdesc: Every man on your crew must know the fuel system so thoroughly that a mistake in its operation is impossible.

fig.title: Auxiliary fuel transfer
fig.desc: Diagram showing the components of the fuel system of an aircraft when transferring fuel for auxiliary tanks.

image.alt: Transferring fuel from the auxiliary tanks.

context.p: To use auxiliary fuel you must first get it into the front main cells.
To transfer fuel from the auxiliary wing cells:

step.cmd: Check fuel levels in front cells to see that space is available for transfer.
Turn auxiliary fuel transfer switches "ON." (On pilot's pedestal.)
Turn liquidometer to the front cell receiving fuel.
After front cell is full, turn transfer switch "OFF."
